grammar_notes: -ER verbs: second most common. Remove -er add endings.
cultural_note: Portuguese meals are social events - 'comer' is a celebration!

mnemonic: EU COMO = I eat - sounds like COMB-o (food combo)!
grammar_notes: Remove -er add -o for 'eu'. Same as -AR verbs.
cultural_note: 'Como de tudo' (I eat everything) - Portuguese cuisine is diverse!

mnemonic: TU COMES = you COMB-es your food? Eat it!
cultural_note: 'Tu comes carne?' is a common question at Portuguese BBQs!

grammar_notes: Remove -er add -e for ele/ela/você. Note: -AR uses -a.
cultural_note: 'Ele come como um pássaro' (he eats like a bird) = eats very little.

mnemonic: NÓS COMEMOS = we eat together - family MEAL-mos!
cultural_note: 'Comemos em família' - family meals are Portuguese tradition!

mnemonic: ELES COMEM = they eat - COMB-em the group!
grammar_notes: Remove -er add -em for eles/elas. Compare: -AR uses -am.
cultural_note: Portuguese families 'comem' together on Sundays - tradition!
'Beber um copo' (drink a glass) - Portuguese wine culture!

mnemonic: EU BEBO = I drink - BAY-bo at the bar!
cultural_note: 'Bebo café todos os dias' - Portuguese coffee culture!

grammar_notes: -IR verbs: third type. Remove -ir add endings.
cultural_note: 'O comboio parte às dez' - Portuguese trains are quite punctual!

mnemonic: EU PARTO = I PART-o from here!
grammar_notes: -IR verbs: -o for eu. Same as -AR and -ER.
cultural_note: 'Parto com saudade' (I leave with longing) - Portuguese melancholy!

grammar_notes: Regular -IR verb. 'A loja abre' = the shop opens.
cultural_note: Portuguese shops often close for lunch - check 'horário de abertura'!
example2_en: I'm going to open the door.

mnemonic: VIVER = VIV-er - to be VIVID and alive!
grammar_notes: -ER verb for existence. Use 'morar' for residence.
cultural_note: 'Viver bem' (live well) - the Portuguese philosophy of enjoying life!
tip: Existence not residence (use morar for location)
example2_en: I want to live in peace.
